did.unittitle: Philadelphia Museum of Art External Affairs Department records

bioghist.p: The External Affairs department grew out of the Urban Outreach department, which operated between 1970 and 1977, and its successor Community Programs, which operated from 1978 through 1982. In January 1983, the Museum created a new Administration office, the Office of the Assistant Director for Program, and recruited Cheryl McLeney-Brooker to head it. According to the 1986-1989 Annual Report, by at least June 1989, McLeney-Brooker became Vice-President for External Affairs, and the office name changed to reflect that title. Her staff consisted of a staff writer, audio-video personnel and an executive secretary. In 1998 the various vice-president offices that operated under Administration became independent departments, including External Affairs. Cheryl McLeney-Brooker now guided the department as its Director, with Diana Myers-Bennett Roberts as Program Administrator. According to the 2006 Annual Report, External Affairs now operates as an office within the Division of Education. Staff consists of Andreina Castillo as Program Coordinator, in addition to McLeney-Brooker as Director.

scopecontent.p: These records document activities held within and outside of the Museum to further the department's ongoing development and promotion of collaboration, outreach, diversity and government relations. Museum activities include special exhibitions, visitor services and special projects and programs. Departmental papers include chronological "Day" files (1989-2001), budget files (1991-2002), as well as incidental bills and invoices. Collaborative efforts and organizations documented here include AIDS Walks (1992-1999); Latino Caucus 1993, Free Library of Philadelphia Summer Program (1999-2002), Legislative luncheons, Philadelphia Folklore Project (1997-1998), Multicultural Affairs Congress (1994-1998), and the Afro-American Historical and Cultural Museum (1992-1997),. The collection also includes records related to the Henry Ossawa Tanner Tanner Exhibition, 1991, the Salgado Exhibition, 1993, and other exhibits, events, and outreach programs (Philadelphia and the China Trade, Puerto Rican Heritage Evening, Martin Puryear, school age programs). Many of these files come from the office of Cheryl McLeney-Brooker, VP of External Affairs.
